intro: Ampliglossum blanchetii, commonly known as the Sierra Valley bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Ampliglossum blanchetii is known for its ornamental value and is often found in conservation areas due to its limited distribution.
